description:
Highlight of my trip here was a ten minute conversation with a visiting elderly Scotsman who was effectively baffled at the lack of McDonalds restaurants in San Francisco.  Evidently, he had developed quite the pallet for McCafe drinks, and had only come into this Starbucks in desperation for caffeine.  I shared that I had seen a storefront McDonalds a couple of blocks away on Market St. while walking earlier, but like me, he had already ordered and was waiting for the team of delightfully-Millenial barista-folk with an extra side of Tenderloin-ilk to get around to preparing it.

Did I mention it was a ten minute conversation?  That's largely due to the ten minute wait for my Red-eye with coconut milk... there was no real line to speak of, and it isn't like I ordered Kopi Lewak served in a Peruvian Paracas skull with a bendy straw... no, they were just kinda on errant Thursday morning time I guess.

The usual gang of puffer jackets and overpriced flannels were sitting in their usual seats designing the usual beta tests and writing the usual screenplays.  Or was that the Toluca Lake Starbucks I was in last week?  I dunno, it's all a blur.

Anyway, the drink was fine, and I suppose the anticipatory wait made me like it more.  Lousy caffeine addiction...  oh, and parking for this Starbucks is $1,200/hr (probably).
author: Ben A.

description:
Not much to say here - basic Starbucks, same type of service as all of them, slow, and sort of robotic.  I don't think the person taking our order ever looked up, couldn't tell if we had pink and black hair, or fangs for eyeballs.  

The barista seemed overwhelmed and the place was dirty.
author: Lynnette F.

description:
This place is the pits I did a mobile order at 6:23,pm and finally my order was finally ready at 6:46pm, plus roget were missing a drink!
 Longest mobile order ever
author: maylene o.

description: I love this starbucks. great and fast service and they have the freshest coffee. There are lots of starbucks.
author: Hailey A.

description:
Boy I tell ya, the only reason I am giving 2 stars is because my latte was almost good.
Talk about feeling like a number, and rushed at that. 
The counter clerks are so quick to raise their tone with you, and give you the most irritable looks I don't know which is worse yet. Seems as if they are having issues with the mobile orders and store orders, could be a cause of their stress and frustrations. Whatever the case may be, I cannot pay money to be treated as I have, while watching others get treated poorly when I visit this establishment.
author: Moon S.

description: Consistently slow service. Don't go here if you're expecting to pick up your mobile order within a reasonable amount of time. Second and last time this location makes me miss my train.
author: monica c.

description: Is there a fucking reason why this place has 5-6 people working at once and only ever has one person on the register?!?!? Once again I am walking out with nothing because to get thru a line of 6 people it takes 15-20 minutes. The only reason I put up with this shit is because this location is right by my job. This is the one location in SF that I've been to where there is no sense of urgency. When I was a barista I was busting out orders fast as hell. I hate this place.
author: PJ L.

description: This Starbucks is pretty decent. It's very busy all of the une, but that's to be expected due to its location. The team here is friendly but you can tell that they're stressed, so don't add to their stress by skipping the line etc. Anyways, they're pretty good
author: Aleyah M.

description:
Date: 2/11/2017  Time: 8:15 PM  57°  Clear night

After the Chinatown Parade, I was hungry again. I hadn't eaten anything since lunch, which was about 6.5 hours ago. I was also thirsty. Okay, where to? Leaving from Post Street and heading to the Powell Street BART Station, I needed to get something quick to eat and drink. No time to sit, just a grab and go. Yelp search of Starbucks brought me to this location. Besides, I also needed to earn my 175 bonus stars for visiting Starbucks 5 days in a row. (That's enough stars to earn a free item.)

It was a little crowded, but the baristas were able to get the line to move quickly. I looked down at one of their refrigerated cases and I did not see my favorite panini - tomato mozzarella. Oh, bummer! I went ahead and ordered a tall shaken passion iced tea with no sugar. I asked the barista if there were any tomato and mozzarella sandwich left because I didn't see any. Response: yes. I looked behind me and lo and behold, there was a line of several people behind me. I could not get to the other refrigerated case to retrieve the panini.

The barista serving me was kind enough to leave his station to retrieve the panini for me. He even had the panini heated up, so I could enjoy it with my iced tea. For that, I am appreciative that he certainly knew how to keep a customer happy.

Too bad that not all Starbucks are the same in pleasing customers. This one is and I am glad I stopped in for a quick meal on the go.
author: Carol C.

description: This is my joint. I come here on a daily basis. And not just cuz. The staff are super friendly and the drinks are never messy. I know it's downtown, and therefore there will be quite a lot of crazy people around, but it's a great place to gets good drink. I would recommend it.
author: Olive R.

description:
By far the worst Starbucks!

First of all, I'm a gold member, well if Starbucks offered platinum or diamond membership, I'm sure I will be one of those. Second of all, there're only 4 drinks that I get (coconut milk macchiato in spring, cold brew in the summer, green tea frap with soy in the fall, and cream brûlée latte around Christmas). Only drinking 4 different things gave me the expertise to compare and critique them.

Never never have I received a watered down coffee. Seriously! I asked for less ice so you add half cup of tap water? I ordered the venti sweet cream cold brew with very very light ice and extra sweet cream. Since I didn't do mobile order I was able to watch the barista make my drink? He added lots of ice and splash of tap water to fill my drink to the top. Really? Add tap water to fill the ice coffee? I saw him do that, and when he passed me the drink he already know there were way too much ice, so he took it back, dumped the whole thing out and made my second cold brew with half cup of water. He gave me the same amount of coffee in the cup, instead of adding ice, he just filled it up with water. I felt like I wasn't drinking coffee, I was drinking coffee flavored water... I waited again to tell him about the drink and was ignored so I left the drink on the counter and left.

Picked up the same drink at another location today, saw them make it, no water were added in my coffee. And I know other Starbucks don't scam customers like that. Beware!
author: Kris J.

description: Its a regular Starbucks, could be cleaner but I like the location and staff are friendly too
author: Jay G.

description: It's a Starbucks. The service was very quick, I received my drink before I even finished paying. The problem was I ordered a grande and it was only about 2/3rds full. The scone was decent but it was just a little frustrating to not get my whole drink. Very kind service.
author: Nathan B.

description:
This is the worst Starbucks expierence I've ever had at Starbucks. 

No exaggeration, waiting 15 minutes to order on New Year's Day. They had one person at the register who was clearly new because they had to keep asking other staff to help with the register. 

I paid for a Protein Box and ordered a Grande Hot Water and a Tall Cinnamon Dolce Latte no whip. I waited another 15 minutes for my name to be called. When it was they gave me a Tall Whole Milk Cinnamon Dolce Latte with whipped cream and no hot water. When I asked for the Hot Water another Barista yelled at me and said I would have to wait until she was done for the row of drinks... for hot water. 

I threw my CDL out and wasted that money. Starbucks is typically fairly consistent but this was horrible.
author: Elena R.

description: I bought a drink and asked for hot water for taking some medicine. The staff refused. I asked if I could pay for hot water, she refused too. This is the most inhuman place I ever went to.
author: Frank W.

description: A good tip. Don't look at people straight in the eye and ignore them. If you are busy just say "sorry one moment please." Acknowledge your customers.
author: Nicolette K.

description: Love that they are open later then other Starbucks in the Financial District. Found my spot before work in not to far from The Sales Force Tower.
author: Carls C.

description: This is across the street from a second Starbucks and while this one looks much larger (corner location, big windows), it actually has MUCH less seating. There's also less space to stand after you place your order and it becomes a bit of a clusterfuck. They also don't have salads while The one across the street does (it's not that they were out- the baristas said they just don't carry salads at this location). Overall fine to stop in if they're not busy, but if you go at a peak time or want to do some work I recommend the location across the street
author: Christina G.

description: The fact that you forgot to make my drink and you forgot to make it soy and you smile at me like im trying to joke with you is not okay 1045 pm guy making the drink when i ask you what happen to my drink and you didnt believe me that i have to tell the guy in the cashier that my order is not in the line is not okay and the fact that i gave tip is not okay and you have the audacity to do someone elses order before you even bother to do mine while you already know u efff up is not okay.
author: Rv Andrew V.

description: I had a 100% perfect experience here today.  I was greeted the moment I entered. My order was taken very quickly by a friendly cashier.  My order was served promptly.   One wish would be for more seating in this busy store.  Please keep up the great work!!
author: Scott B.

description:
Baristas were friendly and my latte was on point.

The place was crowded, but the line moved fast!
author: Veronica A.

description:
The seating situation is pretty awful here- especially because they take away the chairs/stools in the evenings? Given where this store is in San Francisco and the kind of clientele it might attract, I can kind of understand why.. but still. 

Staff is friendly enough and the store is kept clean, although the bathroom was out of service when I visited. Meh. 

I dunno, I'm too pampered and suburban for this location I guess. This is not the kind of store where students post up to do work, that's for sure.
author: Kevin J.

description:
These people work really hard and they deal with a lot of "interesting" people. They're usually open pretty early and pretty late. And while the lines are often long, they do their best to keep things moving quickly.

Good service, good drinks. I'll stop by any time there's no line, haha.
author: Daniel H.

description: Ok this is my first review, ive always wanted a starbucks late late at night, but this is one of the only 24/7 starbucks in the bay, so i drove an hour from san jose and got here a little while ago, i ordered my favorite drink and when i got my drink i told the barista i forgot to pay, not to snitch him out or anything, but he said its ok, i didnt PAY! and i didnt even tell him my journey here and how badly ive always wanted a late night starbucks, i will never forget this night
author: Thomas T.

description: Coffee is alright but man I told the cashier the pastry I wanted, pointed it out to him but sadly he still got the wrong one. The pastries are over priced as it is but to get the wrong one after explaining which one i wanted.
author: Mario M.

description:
Love

Not only do I live Starbucks because they have so many options of drinks and snacks to go with them. 

My favorite drink that wakes me up is the Americano,grande. It is so strong. I recommend that drink to anyone who hates sleeping or had to stay up. 

My favorite cold drink would be the caramel machiatto.  Best commanding if everything. Doesn't have a strong caffeinated kick but that works for this drink.
author: Brandon S.

description:
This is a Starbucks for tourists visiting SF, which I'm guessing is comforting. I'm projecting here but if I was visiting any unfamiliar place I would want to visit something I know, at least once or twice. New experiences are great and all but can also get sensory overload so need comfort to break it up.

Having said that, I never really stop by here as this place is pretty much always crowded. This is not a good place to do work. The extra stars are for convenience - both for the location and for always being opened.

Great for during and after late night outings; a place to go for water/coffee if visitors are KTFO from partying too much, lol. They couldn't even walk here. Luckily, they were staying at a nearby hotel. True story.
author: Peter L.

description:
This review is for the AMAZINGLY AWESOME GREAT morning crew on the weekdays
(Paul, Jon, and Freddie!) 

I have way too many "it's too early to function" mornings. I also dislike that it's still hella dark and that I occasionally walk among crazies. So, I definitely find my sanctuary walking into MY Powell St. Starbucks. They keep the store looking clean and plays some great happy music to create, at best, a nice ambiance (despite the disturbances that come from outside).

Again, what got me to write this review is to really acknowledge these three team members. (Paul, Jon, and Freddie!) They know what it means to keep a customer loyal. They remember my name and my drink order. I no longer need that extra shot of espresso, when instead they give me energy from their smiles. Even on days I don't need a caffeine fix, I want to just come in and say hi! They certainly keep my heart happy. I hope they serve as an example to many others on how to really go beyond customer's expectations and being courteous and kind. 

If you need your coffee, then it's worth getting up EXTRA early just to see these three guys. Also, it's usually a way shorter line in the morning. (;
author: Casie C.

description: I was made to leave after a couple hours went by since I'd ordered anything. This seems contrary to Starbucks' reputation. I had been there much of the night quietly reading and buying refills of my drink. I was told I had to buy something every hour or so. (Since their restroom was closed, it's just as well I didn't do that.)
author: Rick P.

description: They don't let you sit and work here at night coz of all the bums that tend to infest the place. They even try and hide the chairs and got rid of the outlets. Too bad that it's one of the only 24/7 places in the city. What a waste !
author: Rahul K.

description: I went to this Starbucks for a quick coffee run and experienced customer service so terrible, I was appalled. Thankfully, it wasn't towards me but I was so shocked, I feel I need to comment on it. A customer was standing by the area where the ready made drinks are set and they had made one of her drinks incorrectly. The server stayed she would need to make it again seeming frustrated at her fellow employee instead of being remorseful. She then placed another drink on the counter and mistakenly knocked the previous drink over causing it to spill all over the floor and onto that customer waiting for her drink. Instead of apologizing, the server proceeded to say "leave it" to the customer who went to get a napkin to clean herself. Not once did I hear this server apologize or offer to comp her drink for this inconvenience. Knowing the importance of customer service at Starbucks, I feel that this situation was handled poorly. The associate even went as low as calling one of the newer staff members to clean it up for her and said "its bad isn't it" while laughing. Terrible customer service
author: Laura D.

description:
Its early in the morning and the rain just started coming down.  I walked in and noticed wooden counter tops lined up against the windows with very few stools to sit on.  I knew I wanted one of those stools after getting my order.  I strategically eyed an empty seat and wish myself to be seated there.

The line is light with 4 people ahead of me.  I ordered a tall coffee and received my order promptly and the cashier tells me to have a nice day.   Thats nice!  Then I hustle my way over to the stool that I was spying on while I was in line. I sit and begin drinking my perfectly made hot coffee.  Ahh...8:45AM... seated. ...window view... raining...people watch... its perfect... 

Good Morning :)
author: Jenny T.

description: This has got to be the sorry-est Starbucks on Earth. The ambiance is terrible, it's dirty, half the folks in here look like zombies trying to get their next fix. The restroom was broken when I was there, just shut down with no sign of anyone trying to fix. I understand there are a lot of transients here trashing the place, so perhaps they should try a different strategy, but for anyone with any sense, stay away, please.
author: Brian J.

description: Just rude little cole !!!! When somebody asks where their order is do t look at them in disgust and say what !!!!  With an attitude also when a coworker asks you a question just don't stand there and stare at them and not say anything ! Time for you to get another job
author: Michelle B.

description: I like Starbucks. This one is conveniently located across from union square and happens to always be busy. But despite the long lines, my drinks came out pretty fast! The barista that took my order was also extremely friendly so I appreciated that!! Took off 2 stars because my peppermint hot coco wasn't the best (it was ok though), and the store was a bit too chaotic.
author: Jenny E.

description: The service was efficient and pleasant and a step up from the average Starbucks experience. This may have been due to the
author: Tony H.

description: Came to this location at little past 11pm on August 4th, excited to get a drink after realizing this location was actually still open at this time! Will was at the register, and he was lovely. (+1 star!) Once I was handed my drink at the end of the bar, I noticed there was whip cream on top, which I had asked to have without. When I asked the barista about it, his replies were so rude. As though I was largely inconveniencing him, and made such a huge deal about it.. but there was no one else in line at the time to make drinks for? Additionally, his attitude provided the MOST UNPLEASANT experience I've ever had at this.. unfortunately, this guy with slick-back hair was wearing a blank name tag so I was unable to catch his name. Hopefully he isn't making your drink, hah. I truly don't understand why he was hired! If you hate your job, find a new one!! So no one else has to interact with such bitter attitude, thanks!
author: Jacqueline B.

description:
Review a bit past due, but needed

Went to this location on Saturday, December 12 in the early afternoon 

My husband and I stopped in for coffee on our way to a show downtown (by way of information, we were both in suits and ties) and I wanted to use the restroom. He waited in the long line while I went to the restroom. It was unoccupied and had a number code lock. 

Asked the first employee for the restroom code (a young Asian man). He literally made eye contact and walked away. Huh?

Next person I ask, a young African-American woman. She tells me that the code is only available from the cashier. I reply that my husband is in line to buy coffee, and I'd like to use the men's room while we are waiting. She said the manager has mandated this policy. I reply that the policy is asinine and I'd like to speak to the manager, as we are in line to buy coffee (and I've drank my body weight several times over in Starbucks coffee), it's not as if I'm "stealing" bathroom time from the company. Seemingly not understanding the definition of " asinine" she states that if I continue "disrespecting me" you will not get any service. I ask to speak to the manager and am refused 

In the meantime, someone else has obtained then sacred code and there is now a long line to the toilet and we do the bathroom exchange (one out, one in) until I finally get to use the restroom a good 15 minutes later (did I mention it was EMPTY when I arrived??)

I wrote to Starbucks (via email) explained what happened, and stated I wanted nothing free, no coffee, coupons, merchandise. All I wanted was an apology from the manager and the employee who was so rude to me. Otherwise I will never buy coffee from Starbucks again

I did receive a reply. An actual reply to my message, but a completely underwhelming response. Something to the effect, we all make mistakes, allowances should be made. But no apology and none from the elusive manager not the rude employees. 

They have managed to make me a lifetime anti-Starbucks convert. Not only do I not consume anything from this company anymore (home, store, restaurants) I encourage others to no longer suffer the poor treatment and adequate coffee. 

In some ways, I suppose some good has come from this. It's opened my eyes to how the company treats customers
author: Greg J.

description:
This is the only 24 hour Starbucks in the city.  We were heading home late and wanted something for the ride home.  Since it was 2am, parking was available on the street and we had no issues.  Otherwise, you're better off going to an inner city location.  

The service was nice...the drinks were quick to come out.  

Unfortunately, the espresso in our latte was extremely burnt tasting.  Blech.  The shots weren't calibrated appropriately which ruined the entire beverage.  It wasn't edible.  We should've tried our drinks before we left.  Le sigh.  My soy chai was cold.  I understand that they steam the soy chai at a lower temp than lattes...but come on...It was quite horrible.  

2 stars...and no thank you.
author: Jen W.

description: We ordered three drinks without wipe cream and pastries. Surprised the last drink had wipe cream. Clearly the cashier marked it wrong, not Batista's fault. Here's why I'm pissed, instead of fixing our drink while we were waiting, he kept making other people's drinks and completely ignore us. What kind of a customer service was that.  Not a word from him about how long or when he will fix our drink.  I have to ask him to fix it, clearly he has no clue what to do.  And thanks for pouring tons of caramel on my $5 drink, it tasted like shit and shit belongs to garbage so that's where it went.
author: Meni T.

description: There's always a nice  view in the evening but there is a large amount of trash on the sidewalk it seems like all the time I just come at night but maybe there's a difference during the day.
author: Clarence B.

description:
Rude EMPLOYEE. I'm not saying employees because although the others weren't overly friendly they weren't rude. 
I went to SF on 6/17/2017. After dinner and walking down town I went in for a coffee, it was only about 7:30pm the barista was mumbling under her breath and making noises she shook my drink and put it on the counter "here" I asked if it was for me and she said "Idk figure it out I'm so sick of all you coming in here and ordering coffee take the damn thing and leave." She walked away and began complaining as to how she had made more coffees that day than she did in previous days. 
I didn't get her name, I don't even know if she had her name tag. She was the only female worker at that time. 
You would think if you hate making coffees so much you wouldn't work at a coffee shop. It makes you question the kind of people Starbucks employs as well as the time they take to follow up on their stores and their customer service skills. 
I definitely will not be going back there.
author: Maria L.

description:
Probably the worst experience I've had at a Starbucks. The barista was visibly aggravated and the least bit of sympathetic for preparing my beverage incorrectly twice. For some odd reason I found myself apologizing because I felt like such a burden correcting her. 

She did not apologize once and made four beverages for customers behind me in line before returning to correct my order. I made an attempt to catch her name, but she was not wearing a name tag unlike the rest of the employees behind the counter. I will never return to this location and regret initially leaving a tip before receiving my coffee.
author: Laken B.

description: Juan is a wonderful barista (o?). I've watched him greet and treat customers with such respect and friendliness every time I come in to grab a coffee before work. He's such an asset to Starbucks
author: Christina C.

description:
I love coming into this Starbucks, all the staff are so kind and energetic no matter how busy the store is. They're also very accommodating! Whenever a drink comes out not to satisfaction they are quick to correct it and make the customer happy.

I always walk the extra few blocks to go to this location :)
author: Linzy B.

description: I don't usually review Coffee shops, but this place unique during the Holidays. It's located right off Union Square. It's not larger or fancier then other Starbucks. However, this place may as well print cash. During the cold winter Holidays the line is out the door but it moves fast. There are three cashiers and several baristas and other employees stocking and serving. The must churn out an order every 15 seconds. The clientele are from all over world. The group ahead of me were from Spain and the group behind me from the Philippines. The only negative was lines for the restroom was at least 6 deep.  It is probably worst then Latrine in West Africa now.
author: George F.

description: Props to the dude with the brown apron. He made my flat white with soy. It was amazing. Just the way i like it. All the worker here are friendly and very attentive.
author: Christine U.

description:
This location has some of the best service and the friendliest partners I have ever encountered . Sure the area has it's share of less than desirable characters , but the staff always makes sure it's clean and comfortable here no matter what time of the day or night you may end up here ( it's a 24 hr location) Drinks are always tasty and delicious , and despite the near constant line they are somehow always fast and friendly. 
Thanks for my daily caffeine fix 201 Powell!
author: Evan P.

description: This is by far one of the best Starbucks that I've ever been to. It is amazingly busy because of all the tourist that come in but somehow they manage to pull it through. The line moves surprisingly fast. They have some of the best baristas  (Elo, Roxanne, Stacey. Alyssa and a few others.  I'm here usually about 5 days a week. This is my favorite Starbucks to "Starbucks and Chill"
author: Erick M.

description: Forgot about 25% of my order . Everything else was fine but took a very long time for my drink
author: Yordano R.

description: Open 24/7!  Parking near this location is basically always impossible. The staff here is very friendly, even in the middle of the night.
author: Lynsey S.

description:
Where do all the tourists go? Here. Unfortunately it's here.

This place is well laid out but it still can't house the crowd it usually gets from the tourist trap that is Powell.

Head a couple streets over to the one on Market and you'll thank yourself. The service is better and you'll only have to contend with the young professionals crowd instead of the language barrier issues that seem to plague this locale.

Wow and never again.
author: Meg T.

description:
Their restroom was "out of order," so they sent me up the street to another Starbucks where the restroom was "out of order." We had to walk all the way back to our hotel so our autistic son could relieve himself.

Get it together, guys. Having a functioning bathroom should be a major priority.
author: Kelli W.

description:
One of the busiest bucks I've come across, but they are really organized that the lines move fairly quickly. Here, it's an in and out ordeal where you place an order and you are out the door. It's perfect for the city due to it's fast paced lifestyle.

This place is quite small; therefore, it's not a great location to study or even lounge. If you decide to not take my advice, good luck finding chairs. I wasn't able to locate any seating besides the built in benches that were against the windows.
author: Gene B.

description:
This morning, my Starbucks experience was ok, but for a nice young lady who was there at the same time I was, I can't say the same.

While waiting for my latte, I witnessed some pretty rude customer service from the lady working the register. I didn't catch her name, but she had a ponytail with a leopard headband. 

It was pretty crowded there this morning, so getting around wasn't the easiest of tasks. It seemed like there was an error in charging the young lady's credit card, and instead of politely asking to run her card again, she stood at the register barking orders like a drill sergeant while this poor young lady tried to squeeze her way back to the register through the crowd. After finally getting the register, completing the transaction, and getting more attitude from the cashier, the barista had completed her order and was then yelling her name over and over again as she frantically tried to squeeze her way back to the pickup counter. 

I know it gets busy in there, but being busy is never an excuse for poor customer service.
author: Brian B.

description: Way crowded with tourists. the lines snakes out to the door (which is opened for you by a nice homeless guy). It's clear they are inundated and with tourists you get a large grab bag of rude assness. Im sure they're trying their best at times but i think management needs to assess that they need more bodies
author: Kim N.

description:
I usually don't hit up a Starbuck's in the city, there are much more choices to enjoy around the neighborhood, but being that it was early morning and most shops weren't open yet for a decent cup of joe, my friend and I came to this location since it was also near her school.

The line was literally out the door, but it moved fairly quick. My friend was at the back near the door, and when I came back out of the ladies room *clean restroom too for that part of SF, I'm used the 'ewww' factor), we were the 2nd in line to order. The little impulse shopping one does while waiting in line was easily tempted, especially with "San Francisco" on almost anything.

The barista(s) were totally chipper, for an early morning line and busy customers. The drink was done right as well! I may be picky with my drinks, I may have a tough time waiting for my drink and wondering if it was made the way I ordered, but the end result when I get my drink after the mild wait, my morning just brightens up even more after my cuppa joe! :)
author: Dany B.

description: When I first moved to the city, I made it a point to find the most efficient Starbucks. And this one is it. I know the location isn't the most glamorous but the workers are AMAZING. I actually look forward to getting my coffee in the morning and chatting with them for a bit! I am super thankful for this location and the hard working team.
author: Lydia B.

description:
This is the worst Starbucks location in San Francisco. I come only because they are open 24 hours and have a convenient location right in union square, however, it's poorly managed. Your guaranteed to have a rude cashier, a untrained barista that clearly has no clue what ingredients belong in what drinks in a store full of bums and the homeless camped out in and out of there store. 

It took about 4 bad experience visits for me to finally write a review on yelp, tonight, a phone call to Mike, the shift leader, who seemed irritated that I asked what the managers name was and didn't offer to have my drink re-made. 

I'm writing this review while angrily sipping on a spicy peach green tea lemonade made with peppermint syrup instead Peach.
author: Christine B.

description: Very bad customer service!! Cashier is the worst ever. I was opening the app to pay my drinks; however, the cashier was not patient enough and kept asking me to pay. No smiling and no passion in this Starbucks. I won't come back to this one for sure!!
author: Kam Sing L.

description: Starbucks is starbucks, but i guess every baristas still havent quiet captured the way of making great coffee, atleast not here. No consistency. Every time i go here my drink is never the same, either too bitter, too sweet, or not very tasty. Plus this visit today was so busy at 645am and there was a homeless person sleeping (near the bathroom inside the shop) i dont know, you tell me. I dont want to sound insensitive but is that ok for a business?
author: Ledam O.

description: Efficiency is key at a busy urban Starbucks and this place has it down. The staff is crazy in-sync, a well oiled machine. Super cute gentleman at the register was easy on the eyes, and the coffee master on bar kept things rolling. Very high traffic store in the heart of the Union Square area. A small haven from the bustling crowd of tourists makes this a breath of fresh air in downtown SF.
author: Tanner D.

description:
I've come to this location multiple times. And frankly, I don't think I will ever set foot in this Starbucks again. Every person I've encountered at the register or bar has made me feel more like a transaction than a person. I know this is a busy location, but I don't think the baristas and the manager, Benjamin Miller, need to push the customers out the door like they do. The service here is lifeless. The second you've completed your payment(especially in the morning), expect a barista or Benjamin to yell, "NEXT IN LINE." 

On top of this, I'd like my fellow yelpers to know what the management cares about. A while back, I overheard Benjamin talking to a shift lead about not reaching their peak transactions. Sure, money is a necessary evil, but I've experienced some pretty lame service from Benjamin and his team. And based on these other yelp reviews, I'd say I'm not alone. 

Oh, and let's not forget about the homeless who roam around this store endlessly. 

Get it together, Benjamin.
author: Jeffery L.

description:
On the plus side, the line moved quick.

Then you wait 15 minutes for your drink. 

This location seemed overwhelmed. Floor was dirty. Bathroom was dirty. No place to sit for a minute. Think of it as Starbucks Express.
author: Chris B.

description: This is my favorite Starbucks in union square area. Super fast. It can be the longest line to the door but you will still be out of there in 10 mins. I love them! It's on my way to work so it's perfect. Faster and friendlier than the other locations.
author: Ruby S.

description:
I don't usually write review but just want to warn others about the service I received. 


I had the worse experience here with the barista who made my drink. The sweet girl (these stars are for her)who rung me up was super nice and patience. So below is the conversation I had with the barista who made my drink 

Barista : I have a sweetened ice green tea for Steph
Me: oh excuse me I ordered it unsweetened... Cam you please change it for me ? Sorry.....
Barista :(roll her eye ) ok
She then add more what I assume is syrup  and call again. I took the drink had a sip and it taste so sweet. I went back and told her how I ask for unsweetened 
Barista: it was unsweetened to begin with then you told me how you want it sweet. And now you are complaining again..(sigh) here give me it ill fix it for you

By then I was fed up and I just took my sweetened green tea and left.
author: Gar L.

description: Everytime i drink hot chocolate from this place, I start having a bad stomach. And this is not the first time. 6 times in a row. There is seriosuly something wrong with their quality. I am going to file a complain against this place. And please people dont go to this place.
author: Jason M.

description: I noticed some of the 1 star reviews and was a bit puzzled. I can only think of one, recent instance during this busy 2015 holiday season where the staff had a minor flub,  They forgot to give me my mini-scones on my way out the door.  To their credit, they were VERY packed/busy that morning.  I called, they set aside the scones.  I came back and the manager on duty was absolutely apologetic in that they had dropped the scones on the floor and didn't have any to replace them.  She kindly refunded me for the scones AND provided me a serviceable substitute for the broken scones. Excellent customer service and kind staff, I've been going to this Starbucks on and off since they first opened a few years ago.  Thanks, staff, for always doing your best to help and provide great service.
author: Alacrity I.

description: Always like to end my day in Union Square, by stopping in for a Latte, staff is always friendly, even though this is one if the busiest Starbucks!
author: Winny S.

description:
going to keep this short and sweet.....

what kind of 24 HOOURRR Starbucks, puts their chairs up at 7pm? 

you know a place where people occasionally do things like homework, professional work, and have meetings? 

why in the world would you  have people STANDING and doing things like that at a TWENTYYYYY FOURRRR HOOOOOOOOUUUURRRRRR STARBUCKSSSS????

you might as well just freaking close at 7 I don't understand. fix this please
author: Lenay L.

description: I ordered a hot turkey & stuffing panini and it was delivious! I also ordered iced water but the lady today didn't give me the water for 17 minutes... She even prepared someone else's drink first  when those customers were behind me in line. Really now?
author: Jackie T.

description:
Just wanted to Yelp this place because it was our Starbucks of choice whilst staying Downtown.

You guys rocked it with your fast service. 

24/7? It seemed that way.
author: Michael M.

description:
Just as a warning: this is not a 24 hour Starbucks that you can take your laptop/books to and hang out at for a while. There are only about 5 chairs in the entire place, and it's pretty much here to serve large quantities of tourists that come in.

Other than that, it seems to be a Starbucks. Just like any other Starbucks.
author: Al S.

description:
Definitely not the best location to sit and relax - all of their chairs are wooden and they actually have very little seating space. In general the place is very tiny. The lineups can get big in here, but usually it's not bad.

Their wifi sucks though. Probably due to the fact that it is free and any random passerbyer or closeby hotel resident can be using it. 

And the other major point is that it is very unclean. It seems that they're too busy to pull out cashiers or baristas to clean the place every once in awhile.
author: Elisa L.

description:
This Starbucks is north of Market Street and after a day of shopping at Macy's, I needed a shot of java.  The latte was $2.95 and there was no line (3PM) but I felt the coffee was weak compared to the 3 Starbucks I usually visit.  

I think the Starbucks on Market St. and below Market (in Target and across the street  near the Mission St garage) make a better tasting latte.  
It's a great place to sit and watch the reckless, wild traffic of people rushing around Union Square if you can get a window seat.   

The staff were pretty nice (mostly females working today).
author: Ry T.

description:
"Be very, very quiet, it's 3:30 am. Majority of the city are still sleeping and I was one of the very few to start work early. I'll try my best to tip-toe my 200 lb. body to this 24-hours Union Square Starbucks for my cup of joe!"

(RAISING VOICE)

"GOOD MORNING, YOU'RE OFF TO WORK, MATT!?!"

(Damn, I think half of the city is awake by now. I need to unhook my cow-bell around my hallow neck)

Being one of the city's few 24-hours coffee-house, this Starbuck's is continously busy with tourist, nearby hotel guests and shoppers from Union Square/downtown area.  At that time (3:30am), majority of the patrons are tourists from the neighboring hotels going to their airport to their next destinations with different time zone.

I was here to grab my usual: Grande (16oz) House coffee with a shot of espresso for $2.75. And at that time, the coffee came to me quick without the hassle waiting in a long line any other time. I wouldn't recommend you to get up that early and go to this Starbuck's to get your fuel. But with my "off the wall" schedule and since this cornered Starbuck's is 24 hours, do I have a choice?
author: Matt G.

description: The lady barista wearing deer headband (african lady) is very rude, unfriendly and don't know how to make drinks... I worked at the starbucks corp before, the drinks and the way she prepare it, is not starbucks standard! Kindly put her back back to the LATTE standard starbucks training.... Visit: 12/12/15 7:30am.
author: Ryan F.

description: Came here on a chill afternoon. Not really any tourists and only one person in line. Asked for my triple tall cappuccino dry and it was actually was dry! I've never been here when it's been super busy, so I can't really comment on that. But I was happy with my drink!
author: Elena N.

description: Poor customer service, repeated my order at least 5 times and it was still wrong. Ordered an everything bagel with cheese, toasted with cream cheese. They gave me a plain bagel, a container of cream cheese and no knife. Thanks guys!
author: Erin E.

description: What a disappointing experience. Not the customer service I typically get at Starbucks. Putting aside the fact that the person who took my order was super unfriendly, I ordered a smoothie with banana and kale. Another person made my drink and didn't add kale. When I told her that, she said because I didn't order it, she couldn't add it. Apparently the unfriendly partner taking my order did not hear me say kale.  I then offered to pay for the kale right there, but she said she couldn't do that and I would have to get in line (ugh-gain!) to pay for it. I got another store partner to allow me to pay without getting in line again, but even that was difficult.
author: Cas S.

description:
Coffee makes me happy so Starbucks makes me happy.
Especially when I am working in the "Hellmouth" (Macys) at 5am.

The staff is friendly, they get the customers through the line.
Peak times are 8-9am.

The usual homeless crowd outside waiting for ya is always a nice touch.
author: Erika G.

description: What's up with charging a customer 10 cents for a bag?! This is a Starbucks, not a grocery store. Whether I buy an armful of food or gifts for the Holidays, this store is going to charge me to carry away the $$ of purchases I just made? That's BS!
author: Bob M.

description:
I'm a big Starbucks fan (mostly for the atmosphere), and this one has good atmosphere, if you can get in the door. It's in the heart of Union Sq so most of the time it's too crowded and not worth it, but at night it's relatively empty and has good atmosphere. Staff is friendly for working in such a stressful location. 

They recently remodeled, so there's a bar you can stand at in the center, more seating along the windows, and they made the floor-length windows to Powell St. open up, so it's like open-air seating. Good people watching.
author: Ruby L.

description: Starbuck's is Starbucks. When you go into any one of these chains, you already know they are in high demand because of the amount of regular customers they have. Although these places are always busy, these Baristas still manage to get your drink as soon as they can. If you pay attention, they can't/don't socialize while making drinks, and I can see why! Keep up that hustle.
author: Michael W.

description: I had a hair appointment down the street and I needed to kill time.This starbucks just happened to be there when I was in need of a coffee and decided I could study before my appointment. There was no line at the time and I got lucky and grabbed a stool. No tables here and only 6 barstools. I tried to use their wifi but it was not working. Luckily I had my flashcards to study off of, otherwise I would have been mad. This location is pretty much a drive thru for walk-ins. If that makes any sense haha
author: Jamie B.

description: Convenient location, spacious floor plan, power mat charging stations on the table tops, very polite cashier named Eduardo.  All was great...except for the girl at the end of the line handing out drinks...no eye contact, no smile, just slamming down drinks and yelling out what they are.  She handed me the five drinks I ordered and when I could not get her attention subtly, I reached over the glass partition for a drink holder.  That got her attention and the scolding I got still didn't warrant eye contact.  "Sir, don't ever reach over my glass.  If there's something you need, just ask for it."  Amazed...they would certainly do better to have a warmer person to leave those who part.
author: Dan G.

description:
Just your usual Starbucks. Friendly staff, wider range of bakery items then in other Starbucks, unfortunately not many chairs, just few bar style tables at the windows. 
Wireless reception depends on where about you are in the store.
author: G. H.

description: Worst service that I have ever had. Stupid people that work here forgot all about my order, been waiting for 30 minutes
author: Fairlani P.

description: I ordered a Chai tea latte(hot). Why do the people at this starbucks put a lot of cinnamon in the drink or whatever spices it was. Me and my friend both have asthma. We started choking on the powder. At this moment it's hard for us to breathe. Put LESS powder in. I'm telling my friends not to go to your starbucks.
author: Amanda W.

description:
Worst Starbucks I've ever been to!!! Came in around the evening to get some tea. I needed to use the restroom, but she wouldn't let me in unless I purchased something(understandable). She unlocked the door for me & returned to register. I came back out because there was NO toilet paper & NO seat covers. I asked the cashier "Chassie" to repeat my order(what I wanted in my tea), and she snapped back and said "a lemon pound cake and trenta tea" and walked away.. It was completely uncalled for and extremely rude. Horrible customer service. Wont ever come back!

Worst Starbucks I've ever been to!!! Came in around the evening to get some tea. I needed to use the restroom, but she wouldn't let me in unless I purchased something(understandable). She unlocked the door for me & returned to register. I came back out because there was NO toilet paper & NO seat covers. I asked the cashier "Chassie" to repeat my order(what I wanted in my tea), and she snapped back and said "a lemon pound cake and trenta tea"
author: Natalie C.

description: Fast and friendly service. The drinks always taste the same, delicious and hot. I always order the same thing, but it is consistently perfect each time. True, it's always packed, but these workers are so efficient that you are usually out of here by 5-10 mins. I have no complaints except for the occasional loonies that linger in and outside the place.
author: Alex U.

description: Decent Starbucks location, I've been here only once on Christmas Eve and they messed up my order, I wanted a macchiato and they gave me what tasted basically like hot chocolate.. Oh and they forgot the whipped cream. The drink my dad ordered was on point, however, so overall this was a 4-star experience.
author: Vishaal P.

description: I love Starbucks but service here was not good. They don't seem to call out your names or even the drinks. Sometimes they just place the drink on the counter without letting you know and you're left standing there... waiting, waiting for what seems like eternity.
author: Faye F.

description: Came to this Starbucks at 3AM.. I didn't mind seeing a homeless couple cuddling and watching their movie.. but rude employees? No! I ordered a Venti iced green tea latte. 10 minutes later one of the workers handed me a Venti peach green tea lemonade and tells me this is what I ordered. I asked them to remake my drink because this isn't what I asked for and this worker said no, this is what I ordered and that is what I get. Rude.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I come to this location usually before I start my shift at night nearby.  There is a gentleman  (I think his name is Jeremy) who always makes my visits there pleasant.  I'm usually in a grumpy mood and trying to prepare myself for a graveyard shift.  Jeremy and the crew really lift my spirits...and that is even before I get the refresher in my hand.

Oh, and my refreshers are always really good.  

I just wish all of the baristas I run into there were just as pleasant.
author: Di P.

description:
Worst cashier and barista ever. Cashier keeps trying to change the order and upsell a grande when I told him tall multiple times. Also told me that he would never in a million years drink what I ordered (vanilla bean frap w/ eggnog- so good :)-- not that he's even supposed to say that to a customer- I don't care what he thinks!!!

Then. Barista kept flirting with a coworker instead of making the drink. Literally held the pitcher of completed frap in his hand talking instead of pouring it in a cup. Also had to redo the order twice. Ridiculous.
author: Jennifer K.

description: This is the greatest Starbucks on the planet, with the coolest baristas ever working at it.  If you dont like this location its probly because you didnt take the time to get to know the person on the other side of the counter, 201!!!!!
author: Colzie T.

description: It's Starbuck. It's no different than the one on the next corner. It's good for your average cup of on the go joe. The staff looks like an assembly line in a factory. No smiles just work. I wouldnt meet anybody here for business or conversation very loud and crowded. If you are looking for Starbucks it is what it is. If your looking for a amazing cup of coffee there are plenty of places nearby.
author: Brandon L.

description: A pretty mediocre Starbucks in every way except one. I always grab a cup of coffee so I have an excuse to use their bathroom before shopping in Union Square. Bonus points for relief when it's sorely needed.
author: Sean B.

description: Definitely one of my favorite Starbucks to stop by at. Except for the fact that it's a bit messy since they're always busy so I don't blame them. Anyways I have great experiences every time I have been here. The drink here is always delicious only problem I had was that they non longer serve the drink I like at this location. (Strawberry shortcake frappe) well the last time I was here I had a funny experience by the lovely employees who work there. As I placed my order i told the employee to add my friends drink to my bill as well. Therefore she only took down my name. When they called out the order they called out my drink under my name, Juan, "Strawberries and cream frappuccino for Juan!" But when they called out my friends drink it was hilarious "Black Mango iced tea for... For.. For Juan's Buddy" LMFAO awesome enthusiasm from the employees. Definitely two thumbs up with a big smile for this location.
author: Juan C.

description: The usual Starbucks city layout.  Sometimes the lines can feel a bit overwhelming in the mornings before you've had your morning coffee; however, they staff is very efficient and quick.  They take time with you and make you feel like a person, not just a number.
author: Jeremy P.

description: Long line kinda day... 1 employee was just standing there and employees don't ask for help. People were getting upset but because they wanted their drink they just didn't say anything. When I got my caramel frappuccino, it didn't taste like it. The barista was rude and gave me an attitude. Been going to this location and this was the first time that I had a bad experience.
author: Bongmarie L.

description:
I must preface with what I'm about to say with 2 things:

#1 I was in a piss-poor mood after my shopping excursion yielding absolutely no results up to this point, and my head was still on overload.

#2 I was freezing my coulo off because the warm weather had just whooshed out of the city.  I do not like this quasi-cold.  Cold with snow that I don't have to shovel- good.  Windy cold- bad.

So I go in and consider my options.

Do I want the Pumpkin Spice Latte, with it's orange syrup and nutmeg sprinkles which sink to the bottom and I choke on at the end, making me curse all the calories I've consumed?

Or do I want my usual nonfat no-foam latte?

As I am dress shopping and feeling guilty about it, I go for the latter.

So I go in, and there are a bunch of people are milling about.  Most of them have their coffee and aren't in line, so I figure that I'll be in and out.  After all, it's a Starbucks, in the city, in a busy neighborhood, so they are bound to be quick.

BOY WAS I WRONG.  There were 3 people ahead of me, all one group, who didn't know their head from hole in the ground.  Seriously, these people should go back to whatever anti-mensa meeting they came from and play with their blocks and sparkly things, and GET OUT OF MY WAY (this is a common theme).

I finally get up, order, and have no idea what to do next.  The woman who I ordered from, who is standing behind a register, touching it, says someone else has to ring me up.  I am not in the mood for disorganization.  All I have is my Starbucks card and a $20 bill.  I have very little balance left on my card, so the remainder is 95 cents.  I hand her the 20.  She asks me if I have 95 cents.  If I had 95 cents, I would have given it to her.  If she had any sense, she wouldn't have asked.  It's not like it was $100 to be broken down.

ANYHOW, got my coffee, got the hell out.

Ugh.
author: Pam S.

description:
Starbucks coffee is Starbucks coffee. It generally tastes the same everywhere if the Baristas know how to do their job. This review is on the customer service& I have to say it's pretty damn shitty. 

Upon walking in, I noticed the place was full. Stood in line for a long time just to get a tall coffee. They only had one person working the register while one person was off to the side doing something & two other people were hanging out doing nothing at the espresso bar. If your line is out the door, don't you think you should have a second person on the register? Just sayin'. The guy on the register was grumpy too. Grumpy is not a good look on a barista. It'd be nice if they smiled though. Just my two cents.
author: Cat M.

description:
Today with the massive crowds they had on their B game 

Our drinks were taken quickly sweet

I had to remind the woman to give me back MY @#$#@ GOLD CARD-- *shakes fist* 

We got our drinks with no errors sweet 

They forgot a guys child hot chocolates -- bad karma! 

Place was a mess... When I was at Starbucks we were required to do a spin every fifteen minutes-- what happened to that concept? This place needed to have the trash taken out and the condiment area wiped down and re-organized...
author: Vicky T.

description: This Starbucks is well kept especially in such a busy location. Also they had a bathroom thank goodness
author: Diane S.

description:
Always makes my HOT/ICE Caramel Macchiato w/ an extra shot just the waaaay I LOVE it! 

If your at downtown and your looking for a Starbucks that forgets that you've been waiting in line..., well this is one of the fast-pace Starbucks lines to wait in the City.

THEY'RE OPEN LATE AS WELL.

Minus 1 STAR: 
1) It's a struggle to find parking, and I will SMH at you-- if you decide to park at one of those parking garages. Just for coffee...
2) I wish the spot was a lil bit bigger, with a lil bit more tables and chairs just to chill.
author: Johanna M.

description:
Really friendly staff! Standard good starbucks coffee.
Very little room to sit, thats the only downside.
author: Melissa W.

description: Ok, first off I love the coffee and my daughter feels the same way about the hot chocolate.  Now, the part where the staff played the hero:  I was in SF with wife and 2 kids and some how we got separated from mom and my cell phone was dead!  We had no way of reaching her and no charger.  We walked aimlessly through the streets around Union Square until we stumbled into Starbucks, prepared to beg someone for an Iphone charger.  The staff asked if they could help and of course I accepted.  They happily charged my phone for me while we enjoyed our favorite beverages.  I was then able to contact my wife and we were soon reunited!  Thank you Starbucks for employing such wonderful, pleasant, professional and sweet staff!
author: Norm M.

description: The service was great but the amount of bums & homeless entering the store to steal & ask you for money was overwhelming. Yesterday a gentleman threw his coffee cup at the cashier because he couldn't receive a refill. She threw a fit & while that was happening another gentlemen was stuffing 3 juices & food in his jacket. It was insane! We told the staff but they did not seem fazed one bit. Amazing !
author: Geneva S.

description:
.Love Starbucks!  Don't care for the coffee (too rich of a roast) but oh how much I LOVE LOVE the express drinks.. 


Great quick friendly customer service with a smile!
author: Sissy T.

description:
Usually when I'm in downtown SF and I have the choice of choosing Coffee Bean or Starbucks I almost ALWAYS pick Coffee Bean.

So this day was an MAJOR EXCEPTION because of Starbucks' buy one get one free deal. 

Tall Peppermint Mocha with Soy. I hadn't had a normal mocha in forever since I usually get white mocha or vanilla latte, but it was pretty good, I liked the peppermint a lot. Minty coolness with warm chocolate coffee! Yay for cheap coffee! :D 

My friend normally doesn't drink coffee so I almost double fisted my Starbucks but I ended up persuading her into getting a Peppermint Mocha with me. 

Would usually have given it 2 stars because there are usually HUGE lines here and I prefer Coffee Bean but +1 because of the BOGO deal.
author: Constance C.

description: Always a joy to come to this Starbucks; the people are friendly and the lines always move pretty smoothly. Plus it's open 24 hours, so i know where to come when I need my coffee fix at 4AM. I come here almost every day and the employees are starting to recognize me which is fun.
author: Jeffrey M.

description: Another busy Starbucks in the Union Square district. However, I will give them one thing, if you walk in and ask them to ring up five mugs separately, they won't sigh or bat an eye like other places have. I just couldn't give a chain place four stars when it was rather messy, out of napkins, and with schmutz all over the floor.  I know you're busy, but come on, stay on top of it.
author: Jake K.

description:
this starbucks should be shut down for cleanliness violations.  it has so much bathroom fails it was not even funny:

no toilet papers
no toilet seat covers
no hand soap (and they recommend that all employees wash their hands before returning to work?  good luck)
broken toilet seat

yes.  i was here to use the restroom while my friends grabbed drinks.  

oh, and this starbucks was the ultimate sauna experience.  it was hot and humid because the sun was rising over the store.  i felt like i i landed on texas.  and i swear the ac was not on.  what is this?  energy saving month?
author: Alice C.

description: Like all Starbucks, this store has some hit or miss service. But if Fred, Mabel or Raymond is there when I walk in, I know I'm getting great service! Very friendly without being overly, obnoxiously friendly. These three baristas are good at what they do and always start my morning off right.
author: Sara P.

description: Located on a busy corner in the heart of downtown SF. Always packed.  Nothing special. Having been in plenty of SBs in cities like NYC, Philly & Chicago, this one ain't no different.  No real complaints though. got me my java the way I like it.
author: Steven D.

description: Don't get hung up on it being the big bad chain. The bottom line is you can get coffee done anyway you want here without getting robbed.
author: Beekums A.

description: Let me tell you guys, this Starbucks is one of the busiest Starbucks in the nation and they do a damn good job at keeping up with the business problems (homeless, people stealing, rude customers, etc.) they deserve 5 stars for their effort because I know that they are doing their best to accommodate the line, the stores needs, and customers. I am a partner with Starbucks, and I applaud anyone who has the balls to work at this store, because I sure as hell would not. I'm only giving 4 stars because I know that the store tends to be messy, the line is always to do the door, and you will always get a rude barista once in awhile, but it is inevitable at any Starbucks, the condiment bar will get dirty literally right after they clean it, and it's smack dab right in the middle of union square-so it's bound to be busy. The partners are great there if you give them a chance, just pay attention to what you are getting and what is called out! They are open 24/7, almost always have everything stocked, and will serve you quickly (unless there's a huge line).
author: Jewelle B.

description:
Its a Starbucks, I get it. Chain, yadda yadda, all the same, blah blah. Whatever. 

But this location, what in the hell is happening here? Between the clusterfuck that accumulates thanks to slow employees, or just the employees behavior period I always leave this location pissed off or suffering from major second-hand embarassment.  

On multiple occasions their staff has been messing around, being loud and ridiculous while myself and 5 other people wait in line. One time I ordered a soy chai, went to pick it up and the guy making it thinks hes making a funny by asking me "Whole milk, right?".  No dude. Bubbleguts all throughout my workday..not so funny. 

I think from now on I'll be walking out of my way a bit to go to a location that employs functional human beings.
author: Britney K.

description: Tends to be quite busy at this one since it is near union square. Its fun to get coffee and people watch though!
author: Sophia Z.

description: I think this Starbucks has the most mess ups out of all the Starbucks I have been to. I came here a couple years back and they gave my frap to someone else! This time I saw that they messed up this girl's drink. I think this is because they have so many customers. =/  It is in a prime location.
author: Sarah C.

description: i go to this starbucks everyday before work and  today I ordered a turkey bacon breakfast sandwich and when i reached my office and opened the sandwich it was and ham and egg sanwhich being that I'm allergic to pork and bit into the sandwich i was highly upset i called the store and the manager said come  down and well give you a refund which i was happy about but when i got there the cashier was a jerk and when i told him the issue he responds with do you know what bacon looks like ! i was in shocked and i will never return to this starbucks again and being a gold card holder i should never have to deal with such rude service !
author: Tiffanie D.

description:
I've been to quite a few Starbucks in my current coffee addiction but I've never been to one quite this busy nor quite as rude. 

Now I'm not knockin' them for being super busy with tourists and tired shoppers needing something to perk them up for some more fun-filled activities, but the attitude I got when one of my friends' orders was done incorrectly left much to be desired. She declined his offer to remake it and wasn't really too upset over it but the comment we both heard afterwards left us livid. It was a snide and rude comment that left us furious. 

We were better off going to the Starbucks a block down on Cyril Magnin and O'Farrell.
author: Julia W.

description: Starbucks are on every corner but this location is nice with the opening to the sidewalk and the fresh air on a nice day. The service is fast and courteous.
author: Amber H.

description:
They spelled my name right with the first try!!!
No Marina
No Alina
No Serina

Hallelujah, someone at Starbucks actually has a good ear! That deserves a 5 star rating. :))
author: Narina A.

description:
Kate V asked, "Would you rather have a server who doesn't make eye contact with you or a server who calls you sir?"

Good point, Kate V. The chunks in my gingersnap latte spell FAIL.
author: Kimberly V.

description: This Starbuck's was packed on the Saturday after Thanksgiving and the crew in there was jammin' to get everyones drink orders and drinks made. We waited a few minutes in line while waiting to put our order in, and maybe a few minutes more waiting for the coffee. But considering the amount of people cruising through, with the million of drink combo's I thought they did an excellent job to keep things moving. Our coffees were "exactly what we ordered and hot", and we didn't really wait any longer than some of the local ones where they can be as slow as molasses. So Kudos to you guys working so hard, and :-P to the low scores. These worker's did awesome under pressure on a over the top Saturday.
author: Susan D.

description: WTH - Internet doesn't work. Am drafting this review angrily on my phone while in store.
author: B B.

description:
Wow, Starbucks takes urban sucky toilet  to a new level.

Open all night but....they take all the food out of the counter, zombified workers in stained uniforms shifting around muttering, junk all over and if I hear any more of their Disnefied world music CDs I'm going to hurt someone. 

Sometimes they let you use the bathroom, other times they say it's closed after 10 due to corporate policy.   At nights the registers go down so sometimes they write everything down on a sheet of paper, other times they just give you stuff for free.

To their credit, the canned juices, teas, fruit salad, etc., are pretty good and barely more expensive than the grocery store.

They're having a lot of trouble handling the neighborhood and I wonder why they try, the mess and disorganization hurts their image.

I'm reluctantly raising their raitng to 2 stars because the staff is very good.  They try hard and they know what they're doing.  I'm just not used to starbucks employees yelling at homeless people.  At least they call the unkempt guys trying to steal milk and sugar packets "sir" -- corporate policy of respecting everyone.
author: Gil S.

description:
wow. i had been feeling badly about my review of this starbucks for the last couple weeks; thinking that it was unfair to dole out a 2-star review for a place at which i had one bad experience, but still regularly patronize. that was until this morning, when i received a coffee... minus the coffee. 

every time i go to starbucks, i order the same thing. "grande caramel macchiato for kris, please." it's not a complicated order or anything, so i'm not sure why this location seems to have trouble with it. i'm one of those wimps for whom coffee is too hot, so i usually get coffee on the way to BART, and drink it at some point during the ride. this means that today, i was already underneath the bay and five sips in before i realized that what i was drinking was hot milk, sweetened by caramel and vanilla shots, but with no espresso at all. let me repeat my earlier statement: A COFFEE... MINUS THE COFFEE. and for the record, when you are on a long train ride and clearly need caffeine to stay awake, warm, sweetened milk is the exact OPPOSITE of what you want to drink. 

i understand that all the starbucks near union square are bound to be teeming with tourists, and their barristas, therefore, a bit slammed. no, i don't expect them to be able to swirl a capital K into my foam with the espresso, the way the peet's in my old (suburban) neighborhood would. however, i do expect that when i pay $4.15 for coffee, i actually get coffee! and i imagine that since most of their customers are tourists, they'd be happy about, and quick to serve someone like me, who makes an efficient and decisive order and actually says please. clearly this is not the case. there are three morning barristas i've seen who are friendly and efficient: short guy with brown hair and electric blue eyes, tall girl with blondish-brownish hair and glasses, and slightly older asian gentleman with glasses. sadly, those three can't make up for the apathy of the rest of the staff. and i say apathy with confidence, because how much do you actually have to care to put COFFEE in my COFFEE? apparently more than most of these barristas. 

dear yelpers: if you're in this area and in need of coffee, i HIGHLY recommend that you visit the starbucks at 442 geary. even though the amazing eddie no longer works there, it's the only starbucks in union square that i've been to that seems to care about customer service. don't believe me? check out my (fuzzy) cellphone pic of me dumping my starbucks coffee into an empty peets cup (where i ultimately found caffeine/salvation). and by coffee, i mean steamed milk and caramel.
author: Kris G.

description: One of the busiest Starbucks downtown. Be prepared  to wait at least 10-15 min for a drink, especially during the weekends.
author: Andrew A.

description:
What people don't understand about a busy store is that it is very hard to keep it clean and move as fast as a neighborhood store.  The Starbucks on 201 Powell is bombarded by tourists who don't speak the English well, so they have a hard time ordering when they don't even understand what the names for the drinks even are.  The line slows down that way and the Barista's try their best to expedite the line by taking orders before you get to the register, so they can get started on your drink faster.  A line of drinks also take time to make, since there are ingredients that go into them.  There is the syrup, espresso, and steamed milk that go into a more complicated hot drink and frappucinos are the most complicated for the cold drinks.  The condiment bars and bathrooms get trashed every ten minutes because the store is so busy.  A barista is not able to clean all that thouroughly constantly when its there is a crowd of people standing over the mess.  The milk is changed out about every ten minutes because so many people pour that milk into their cups.  You should tell Starbucks to have 10 people working at one time if you want a perfectly clean and fast running store, but they would probably go broke and so would every other food business.  You can not expect the best from downtown.  People have the wrong idea of getting the best from a city.  I believe smaller cities can give you better service.  But then again, if you put a person trained in the big city into a smaller one, that would probably be the best.  

Now, for the bathroom there is usually a long line and that makes it hard to clean.  Imagine if you worked for that store and you had to ask the people in line if it was ok for them to wait longer so you could clean it.  Most people are ok with it, but you do get some rude people who would rather knock you down and make you cry before they let you go in BEFORE they do.  It is even hard for the workers to use the bathroom that they have to go to another store to use one.  Just be happy that there is even a bathroom to use because you wouldn't want to pee on the street would you.

On another note, baristas try hard to serve the customers, but when the day has been too long and too full of nonsensical customers you get fed up sometimes.  You need to talk with your co-workers unless you want a boring life and never ever talk with the people you work with and stress out all day about the dumb people on the otherside of the counter that you sometimes have to deal with.  Imagine yourself working at a busy retail environment.  What would you really do?  Concentrate on the customer and only the customer your whole 8 hour shift and not communicate with the other workers at all? Seriously?  Give me a break.  I bet all those people that give this place bad reviews are people who have never had a job or never had a lower paying job.  They are just high and mighty people spoiled by their parents or rather a high paying job that they may or may not have worked hard for, but you should you really think about the position of the store and its workers before making a judgment.  That goes for any other judgments you might make as well.
author: Linda L.

description: I don't know why I keep coming here. There's another Starbucks *right across the street* which always has shorter lines and baristas who are less likely to mess up your order. And, I mean, there's actual coffee (good coffee) just down the hill at the nearby Blue Bottle. But I keep finding myself down in union square and wanting a "coffee"-based drink like a frappuccino, and then I end up here. I must have some kind of complex. On the other hand, frappuccinos are kind of good...
author: James B.

description:
Always has long lines of frozen tourists, who forgot to bring their jackets during the summer.  So, if you are a tourist reading this review, remember "LAYERS" are the key regardless of the time of year in SF.

The service is eh b/c they are always freaking bombarded with randoms.  Do they have neighborhood folks that stop in here?  Probably not, b/c I'm sure that those people find another less crowded starbucks.

Also, the 1 star is for the bathroom, which is GROSS.
author: Hiromi N.

description: Let's face it, it's cookie cutter coffee but this location has the nicest staff working there in the mornings.  I go every day on my way to work and despite how I might feel walking in, I always feel cheered up on my way out.
author: Jasper S.

description:
Die bastards, die, die.
I don't hate many things, but I do hate the coffee-evil-empire.
This review is not about this particular Darth-Vader-locale, but about the chain in general.

The black muck water they sell is disgusting, the fake vocabulary they invented is ridiculous (venti my ass!) and the hideous logo makes my stomach turn.

Plus, minus 55 stars for daring to open one of your eye- and taste bud-sores across the street from the best and most famous coffee house on the planet. And a big FU to my fellow a*hole Europeans for letting that happen.
author: Tatjana G.

description:
We came here for a cool refresher after walking around downtown. It was pretty crowded, but they were incredibly effiecient: taking orders whilst people were in line, not being out of food, and being generally in a good mood.
I even asked the nice woman ringing me up if it's normally like this. She was so ridiculously calm (I suspect benzodiazapines) and said "oh sure, but it's 10 time worse at the holidays." Ewww. And she said this smiling. Impressive.
I rather like the fact that it was a ton of shoppers and tourists simply because most of them wanted to be in and out of there, meaning we got a table to rest and regroup from the possibility of blisters.
author: Kat C.

description: So, we stopped in here a couple times on our SF vacation.  Long lines, very busy, you're not gonna relax here, because there are only a few tables, and a small bar area.  I'm used to being able to grab a seat at Sbux and sit for a while.  Here, it's in and out! I think they need to pay the workers here more, because it seems nonstop!
author: Mike K.

description:
Always overcrowded and understaffed.  Everything takes FOREVER.

And I was scoffed at when all I wanted was a scone.  What is so strange about just wanting a scone?!
author: diana s.

description:
This is the Starbucks I visit every morning before my MUNI commute to work. While it's decent, they seem to always have problems around the 8:20-8:30 AM time frame.

This is my thought...I'm not in the coffee world, but maybe someone from Starbucks Corporate will read this and say, "Hey...that's not a bad idea! Let's do it!"

They usually have about 5 people there working in the mornings. They should have about 6, in my opinion, since it gets so crazy there with the lines continuously going out of the door. They need two people on the bar, two people on register, and the other two getting pastries and their "gourmet warmed breakfast sandwiches" ready. They could even use one of those pastry folks to do a spin (clean up and refills) when it is a little slow.

Instead, it usually takes about 10-15 mintues for a coffee and donut to be in my hands from walk-in time to when I am pouring milk into the coffee. I understand you're busy, but when they have the associates joking with one another and standing there, virtually doing nothing but having a conversation, then that's kinda odd to me...and upsetting to a few individuals that I've seen get irrate and yell at them for.

The service is fairly nice. Every morning I am in there, I hear every associate say, "Good morning Mary" to one of their regulars. I've been going in there virtually every morning for the past year and a half, and have gotten nothing. Not even a "Good morning." I feel loved...::sniff sniff::

Three stars because they deal with the homeless, and they are open late, and they can be nice at times. But work on better outcome for the customers, as well as being friendly to ALL customers, not just the few that are always there.
author: Nicolas H.

description: Just stopped for coffee break, noticed not enough seating. Like not enough at all. It's a busy location, so there should be more seating.
author: Brinda G.

description:
This isn't another Starbucks I go to often, but if I need a quick fix while I'm shopping around Union Square, it's convenient.  There tend to be a lot of tourists and the queue can get long depending on the time of day.  I've found the actual coffee to be your run-of-the-mill Starbucks.  Again, this isn't a place I'd sit and enjoy my coffee.

*WiFi hotspot (TMobile)
*Oven-warmed food
*iTunes WiFi Music Store
author: Brent A.

description: Okay the stuff is the same at every Starbucks, but the service at this location was sooooooooooooooooooooo slow. I ordered a black iced tea with one Splenda. There were 2 people ahead of me, one person whose order was already almost done. There was one barrista (that's fine), but when the other barrista came and talked to her (in loud Cantonese might I add), she stopped what she was doing and started to talk. It was scorching hot with the sun just blazing into the store front. I was hot as hell trying to shop before my haircut appointment. All I wanted was a cool drink. I had 15 mins before my appointment and by the time I got there (which was right next door), I was already late. Does it really take 15 mins plus to get an iced tea? It's pre-made for god's sake!
author: Anita L.

description:
Friends don't let friends go to starbucks. 

This city has good coffee, don't drink this sugary crap.
author: evan r.

description:
+1 star: because its a Starbucks
- 1 star: dirty bathroom & counter (code is 8282 last time I checked)
+3 stars: its open 24 hrs
-1 star: too many homeless waiting outside asking for change
+1 star: they haven't messed up any of my orders.... yet
-1star: there's ALWAYS a line, no matter what time of day/night
+1 star: good place to people watch
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3 stars: so if this place wasn't open 24 hours a day, I guess I would given it no stars at all.  Math sure is fun!~ Need a calculator?
author: Sang K.
