description: Drinks here are consistantly what I'm looking for. They have a well cleaned lounge area. The only issue I've seen is that the bathroom wasn't well kept the two times I've used it, which is the only thing keeping me from giving this higher marks!
author: Sean W.

description:
Starbucks! You get stars for being open 24 hours! And you get stars for spitting a crazy long receipt at me during my last visit, which I just found and it led me to a little online survey for a free tall beverage! 

You were really tacky and had all of your boxes out in the open by the window though and I was visually confused! Tacky and not good!
author: Lily K.

description:
There was a horrid time in San Francisco when we had no 24 hour Starbucks locations. After moving back from SoCal, this was a stark reality I just had to accept. Then angels sang and the clouds parted and God granted us this craphole. (Then later making up for his mistake by giving us the lesser evil of the Laurel Heights 24 hr Starbucks.)

Due to this Starbucks' location, it almost ALWAYS has a long line scooting close to the door. I've come here at night and odd hours of the morning, and the line is still bad. And since this place is almost always busy, they run out of drink-making materials constantly. After visiting the place five times in a row and not getting any of my normal drinks (nor good suggestions of alternatives from the baristas), I gave up on this place. There are half a dozen Starbucks locations within four blocks of this place and it's just not worth suffering through the poor service.

Since this Starbucks is the most prominent for tourists, they tend to stuff up the line with their slowness. If you just want a coffee like I often do, you'll have to stand there for twenty minutes as the group of ten decides who is getting what, who is paying for what, and why the heck Starbucks calls small sizes "tall."

Given that this place is a closet, there is hardly any seating. There's probably a total of six tables based solely on the fact that is all they can cram inside. I suppose it doesn't matter since Union Square is a block away, but whatever. And yes, their bathroom is as hideous as you think. Hold your pee and go down two blocks to Nordstrom in the SF Shopping Centre if it's still open. If not, I don't suggest peeing in an alley nearby as cops frequent this Starbucks all hours of the day and night.

If you're going shopping and walking around to begin with, skip over this place as there are better Starbucks stores to go to. No matter what direction you're heading, there's going to be better service. But this place is adequate during late night, just hope all the drunk club-hoppers don't get in line before you. Though not surprising at all, more of them head to the other 24 hour Starbucks than this place.
author: Grace-Monday B.

description: I go to this particular Starbucks six to seven times a week and I really, really like it here! I must mention that many of the employees have gone out of their way to make conversation with me or recommend the best pastries. Considering how busy they are, this kind of customer service really sticks out. Yeah, there's been a couple times when I've had to wait light years, which is my reasoning behind the four stars... but this is understandable. My favorite things to order are the pumpkin cheese muffin (seasonal), cheese danish, or the vanilla bean frap with caramel drizzle. God, I love you, Starbucks.
author: April S.

description: I don't about the not so good reviews for this Starbucks... but this is where I get my tall soy tuxedo mocha everyday. Even when I just started coming here everyone was very friendly and attentive. And now that they know me, it's just an added bonus that by the time I get to the register, they've already started steaming soy milk. There is another starbucks nearby but I prefer this one, even if this is a busier one, they get the drinks out quick and best of all... they make the drinks right!
author: Cherry S.

description:
it's on powell.  that about sums it up.  toooooooons of tourists - half of them are  like, omg, i'm in a starbucks for the first time!! ok, maybe not quite, but that's what it feels like.  and there's never anywhere to sit.  

i go there b/c it's OPEN 24HOURS.  i guess maybe that should earn it more stars, but no.  it's still nice to know it's always open.
author: Alexis W.

description: Ok seriously this is the worst Starbucks ever in history I swear, so I work right down the street at Rasputin ( im the boss) and I usually would go into starbucks to get coffee at least 3 times a day Cinnamon Dulce Latte witha extra shot and soy porfavor. All thee time I would go in there and I hated the vibe off top until I met this beautiful girl who some what actually had a personality. Shes the only reason why I went 30 times a day but this place sucks so much she even cut turf smmmhhhh. So I go in there and this girl her name is LIZ drops my f-in sandwhich and puts in the bag.  Are u serious u crazy lady tell me u didnt do that, all she said was " my hands are clean and the floor was mopped". WHAT THE HELL U DUMB IDIOT U JUST DROPPED MY EFFIN sandwhich on the floor. She made me another one and still charged me. Another time my total was 8.60 and I said "jesus christ what the hell thats the most expensive coffee ive ever had". The chick replied " its starbucks what do u expect duuh". Ok screw u ! Now i go to the bart station on Powell and they are so nice one time i spilled coffee all over the floor right during closing the girl was soo nice she made me a new cup and didnt charge after she already started cleaing.  I hate this place sooo much they know me as Judas or Tiger because I wnt tell them my real name  GRRRR!
author: Josh-davey D.

description: This is a really great starbucks.  I highly recommend this one for all the coffee lovers out there.  Very friendly staff as well.  Good work guys!
author: Adam S.

description: Wow, can't believe a coffee place has a line at 11pm at night!! Well, we are not coffee drinkers but we had some gift cards from some past occassions and decided to grab some juices here. They had Odwalla juice and reasonably priced too, compared to the juice prices at a nearby Walgreens!
author: Yan M.

description: Zach is the best manager in the whole world!!! If he is not the manager he needs to be one! So much energy and keeps the whole staff happy and motivated!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Laura A.

description: One of the more efficient Starbucks I have been to recently. When I visited during a shopping excursion, the line was almost out the door. However, the staff here were great with the service and the wait time was kept to less than 5 minutes during the busy holiday season.
author: City M.

description:
yay for being open 24hours.

nay for long lines.
author: Robin L.

description: Starbuck is Starbucks is Starbucks.  Yes, it is the same everywhere, but this location is terrible.  It is completely run down, paint chipping, corners dented, and slow, annoyed service.  You need a code to get into the bathroom, and not just any employee will tell you what it is.  You have to ask the busy guy at the register.  The barista girl yelling out the order had the snobbiest tone of voice and was not cheerful.  Walk another block to find a better Starbucks.
author: Julie R.

description: I hate this starbucks.  Came here, ordered a frappacino with a floating shot...double check with the guy doing my order that it would be floating since he seemed to be paying more attention to his casual chat with the other workers.  He confirms...i get my drink and there's no floating top.  I tell the worker, and he starts argueing with me, telling me that he blended it in(not what i asked for, I like the way the floating shot smooths out the ice chunks) and seems just completely unable to grasp the concept that I wanted it floating not blended in and that it isnt the same thing.  Won't be going back here...getting the drink wrong is one thing, argueing with me about fixing it when i just paid $5 for my drink is not acceptable.  Go to another one...i think they just dont care here because of all the tourists.
author: Brett T.

description: Don't go to this starbucks.....there is one down the street on O'farrell with outside seating and without the long lines of tourists.
author: Jessica H.

description: While this is a chain, I'm in love with their cinnamon dolce lattes and pumpkin spice lattes (tall, please, thank you). The staff is friendly, and for once, they keep the bathroom clean with a key to keep non-customers from using the facilities. Just wished they would mop the front area a little more and pick up some of the trash around the napkin holder etc.
author: David G.

description:
first off ive never been much of a starbucks guy...

but since i saw through the glass door that there were only 2 people in line i figured i'd give it a go. but what i didnt see was the huge group of people who had already ordered standing there waiting for their coffee. what i expected to take 2 minutes turned in to a10-15 minute wait for an ice coffee. perhaps im very impatient, but even though the place is filled with tourists who have no idea what they want and more than half i feel are only in there just to use the bathroom, i still felt the service could have been much faster. from what ive seen here this is a place one should only go to if they simply need to sit down for a few minutes and be in no rush to get their coffee/food, or are in town for a few days and dont know better. this place is one of the larger starbucks ive seen, even though ive noticed that getting a table at this place isnt always easy. luckily for us, starbucks has graced us with another 50 or so locations within walking distance so finding another isnt a problem. 

i would say that its much easier to go the location on the other side of union square up by sutter/stockton, or just go to borders.
author: Andrew D.

description: i go here regularly in favor of the stockton street location. i've been affronted by a very rude barista once here, but usually the service is pretty good. in the morning i also try to take a short black coffee to whichever homeless person  is sitting outside since it's one neighborhood where i always feel like i can make somebody's morning. maybe this is a wierd thing to think is nice about the starbucks, but for me it is.
author: lisa w.
